channel.title: Set an alarm using Windows Task Manager!
channel.description: I found this a great way to set an alarm so I can get up every morning. First, go to Start->All Programs->Accessories->System Tools->Scheduled Tasks. Create a new task and name it whatever you want. Then for the program browse to the song or playlist you want to play. Now set the time you want it to go off and if you want it to go off every day or what. What until the specified time and Voila! This would also work with other programs so if you want to play a video at 3 am to bug the hell out of your brother ;D

item.title: Set an alarm using Windows Task Manager!
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:19, topic:255533”][quote author=PeterMan link=topic=337642.msg2632015#msg2632015 date=1232240021]

use an alarm clock like normal people,then you can slap it and it stops

My mom wakes me up and I aproach here the same way as an alarm clock.
[/quote]
ic ic, do you slap her hard[/quote]
I belive so, she has been flat out on my floor for about 5 hours now.

Read full topic

item.title: Set an alarm using Windows Task Manager!
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:14, topic:255533”][quote author=MujaheD link=topic=337642.msg2630114#msg2630114 date=1232103559]
I set one of my mp3’s as an alarm to wake me up in the morning, but after it’s done playing, it keeps repeating it. Anyway to stop this?
[/quote]
End the task?[/quote]
Yeah, that works. But in the morning, I really wouldn’t be in the mood! Thanks though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

good job its only been there since windows 95

Tbh, I don’t think many people realize that it can used as an alarm clock and play music. Best part is that you don’t have to download anything.

item.title: Set an alarm using Windows Task Manager!
item.dc:creator: @Microsoft2 Microsoft®
item.description:
@Microsoft2 wrote:

Agent766:

I found this a great way to set an alarm so I can get up every morning. First, go to Start->All Programs->Accessories->System Tools->Task Manager. Create a new task and name it whatever you want. Then for the program browse to the song or playlist you want to play. Now set the time you want it to go off and if you want it to go off every day or what. What until the specified time and Voila! This would also work with other programs so if you want to play a video at 3 am to bug the hell out of your brother ;D

Sorry but there is no “Task Manager” in System Tools folder.

Read full topic
